memberdef.argsstring: (const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn1, const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn2, OutputIterator oi)
memberdef.name: difference

briefdescription.para: computes the difference of two polygons and inserts the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertibe to Polygon_with_holes_2<Kernel, Container>.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn1, const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn2, OutputIterator oi, UsePolylines=Tag_true())
memberdef.name: difference

briefdescription.para: computes the difference of two polygons and inserts the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundaries of pgn1 and pgn2 are treated as cyclic sequences of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as a cyclic sequences of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, pgn1 and pgn2 are converted to a general polygons bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygons with holes are converted back to standard polygons with holes. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, pgn1 and pgn2 are used as is. Refer to Traits Selection for more information.
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertibe to Polygon_with_holes_2<Kernel, Container>.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

briefdescription.para: computes the difference of two polygons and inserts the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundaries of pgn1 and pgn2 are treated as cyclic sequences of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as a cyclic sequences of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, pgn1 and pgn2 are converted to a general polygon and a general polygon with holes, respectively, bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygons with holes are converted back to standard polygons with holes. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, pgn1 and pgn2 are used as is. the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertibe to Polygon_with_holes_2<Kernel, Container>.

briefdescription.para: computes the difference of two general polygons and inserts the resulting general polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

memberdef.name: difference

briefdescription.para: computes the difference of two general polygons and inserts the resulting general polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertibe to General_polygon_with_holes_2<Polygon>.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.
GpsTraits must be a model of GeneralPolygonSetTraits_2.

detaileddescription.para: There are several overloaded function templates called difference() that compute the difference between two polygons and insert the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundaries of the input polygons are treated as cyclic sequences of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as cyclic sequences of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, the input polygons are converted to general polygons bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygons with holes are converted back to standard polygons. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, the input polygons are used as is. Refer to Traits Selection for more information.

listitem.para: The types Type1 and Type2 of the parameters must be convertible to the types specified in a row in the table below, respectively. The 3rd column specifies the corresponding dereference type of the output iterator.
The types that apply to signature (1.1.) above are restricted to those listed in rows 14 in the table below.
The types that apply to signature (1.2.) above are restricted to those listed in rows 58 in the table below.

parameterdescription.para: the output iterator for the result.
